abstract.text: Quickly get driving, cycling, or walking directions, whether the trip is nonstop or it has multiple stops.
An instruction about an upcoming
’s maneuver, optimized for speech synthesis.
Attributes are metadata information for a route leg.
A
object is a structure that specifies the criteria for results returned by the Mapbox Directions
API.
A
object indicates a location along a route. It may be the route’s origin or destination, or it may be
another location that the route visits. A waypoint object indicates the location’s geographic location along with
other optional information, such as a name or the user’s direction approaching the waypoint. You create a
object using waypoint objects and also receive waypoint objects in the completion handler of the
method.
A
enum represents the weight given to a specific
by the Directions API. The default metric is a
compound index called “routability”, which is duration-based with additional penalties for less desirable maneuvers.
A skeletal route leg containing only the information about the route leg that has been refreshed.
A
clarifies a
with directional information. The exact meaning of the maneuver
direction for a given step depends on the step’s maneuver type; see the
documentation for details.
A
specifies the type of maneuver required to complete the route step. You can pair a maneuver type
with a
to choose an appropriate visual or voice prompt to present the user.
A Directions Refresh API response.
describes corresponding object on the route.

indicates the level of detail in a route’s shape, or whether the shape is present at all.
Options for calculating results from the Mapbox Directions service.
Information about toll payment method.
The accuracy of a geographical coordinate.
Computes distances and durations between origin-destination pairs, and returns the resulting distances in meters and
durations in seconds.

along the route.
A
indicates the level of traffic congestion along a road segment relative to the normal flow of
traffic along that segment. You can color-code a route line according to the congestion level along each segment of
the route.

Option set implementation which allows each option to have custom string value attached.
The contents of a banner that should be displayed as added visual guidance for a route. The banner instructions are
children of the steps during which they should be displayed, but they refer to the maneuver in the following step.
This class can be used for :
:nodoc:
The tendency value conveys the changing state of traffic congestion (increasing, decreasing, constant etc).
A
object represents a single distinct maneuver along a route and the approach to the next maneuver.
The route step object corresponds to a single instruction the user must follow to complete a portion of the route.
For example, a step might require the user to turn then follow a road.
A skeletal route containing only the information about the route that has been refreshed.
describes any corresponding event, used for annotating the route.
An error that occurs when computing matrices.
An error that occurs when encoding or decoding a type defined by the MapboxDirections framework.

object is a structure that corresponds to a directions response returned by the Mapbox
Directions API.
Computes areas that are reachable within a specified amount of time or distance from a location, and returns the
reachable regions as contours of polygons or lines that you can display on a map.
A single cross street along a step.

indicates which side of the road cars and traffic flow.

A
object is a structure that specifies the criteria for results returned by the Mapbox Map Matching
API.
A
specifies the mode of transportation used for part of a route.
is the level of traffic congestion along a road segment in numeric form, from 0-100. A
value of 0 indicates no congestion, a value of 100 indicates maximum congestion.
A
object defines a single route that the user can follow to visit a series of waypoints in order. The
route object includes information about the route, such as its distance and expected travel time. Depending on the
criteria used to calculate the route, the route object may also include detailed turn-by-turn instructions.

object attributes.

Provides a text value description for user-provided options.
A
object defines a single leg of a route between two waypoints. If the overall route has only two
waypoints, it has a single
object that covers the entire route. The route leg object includes
information about the leg, such as its name, distance, and expected travel time. Depending on the criteria used to
calculate the route, the route leg object may also include detailed turn-by-turn instructions.
Quickly get driving, cycling, or walking directions, whether the trip is nonstop or it has multiple stops.
The velocity (measured in meters per second) at which the device is moving.
An object describing time zone relevant information.
A system of units of measuring distances and other quantities.
A
object defines a single route that was created from a series of points that were matched against a road
network.
